word_mean: 预期：发生特定事项或情况的可能性

sentence.Network_en: Average life expectancy went down from about 70 to 67.
sentence.Network_cn: 平均预期寿命从70岁左右降到了67岁。

sentence.Network_en: Three of the six have comfortably exceeded their normal life expectancy.
sentence.Network_cn: 6人中已经有3人轻松超过了正常的预期寿命。

sentence.Network_en: The supporters had a tremendous air of expectancy.

PerfectNetExp.abs: African - American women are another group of low expectancy because of their high rates of obesity ., 由于非裔美国女性高比例的肥胖现象 , 她们是平均寿命低的另一人群.
the health expectancy of the oldest old in china ., 中国高龄老人健康预期寿命的研究.
小升初英语语法归纳5_英语网上海分站 ... goal n． 目标 expectancy n. （根据概率得出的）预期数额 position n． 位置.

list.abs: 虞字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 准备,防范〖 prepare〗 企望;期待〖 hope;expect〗 贻误;欺诈〖 bungle;cheat〗.
英语doing与to do的区别_爱问知识人 ... mean 意欲，打算 expect 期望 omit 忽略，漏.
The embarrassment of buying the aircraft were expected to improve in the next few years ., 买飞机人的尴尬在未来几年有望改善.
物业常用英语（2）_中华会计网校 ... discounted cash flow models 折现值现金流量模型 expectation 期望值 letting 出租.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin exspectantia, from exspectare 'look out for' (see expect)

entry.def: Expectancy is the feeling or hope that something exciting, interesting, or good is about to happen.

example.ex: The supporters had a tremendous air of expectancy.

means.word_mean: 2. something expected (as on the basis of a norm);

sentences.sentence: "each of them had their own anticipations"

Sentence.sentence: It helps increase their life expectancy.

sentences.en: Japanese people have a very high life expectancy.
sentences.cn: 日本人的平均寿命非常长。
我们因期待而神经紧张起来。
